body_html:
I think addbmm and baddbmm should also be modified. (at least its docstring)
According to addbmm's docstring, it says
addbmm(beta=1, mat, alpha=1, batch1, batch2, out=None) -> Tensor,
however positional arguments after the keyword argument are not allowed in python.
As a big fan of using keyword arguments whenever possible, it would be great for me if I can use keyword arguments on every C binding.

body:
I think addbmm and baddbmm should also be modified. (at least its docstring)
According to addbmm's docstring, it says
`addbmm(beta=1, mat, alpha=1, batch1, batch2, out=None) -> Tensor`,
however positional arguments after the keyword argument are not allowed in python.
As a big fan of using keyword arguments whenever possible, it would be great for me if I can use keyword arguments on every C binding.
